Utterances.UttText: GC is a 55F with cHTN diagnosed 10 years ago who presents following an episode of chest pain 3 days ago.

MappingCandidates.CandidatePreferred: GC, vitamin D binding protein, human
Life Expectancy Less than Ten Years

Phrases.PhraseText: an episode of chest pain 3 days ago.

Utterances.UttText: She describes substernal pressure that "took her breath away" and reports feeling faint.
This episode lasted 5-10 minutes and resolved after sitting in her car.
It is the first time she has had pain this severe, she reports previous "twinges" over the past 4 mo with exertion.

Phrases.PhraseText: over the past 4 mo with exertion.

Utterances.UttText: She denies resting SOB, current chest pain, swelling of extremities, headache, vision changes.
She has not been seen by cardiologist and denies previous testing.
She does not have a blood pressure cuff at home.
She reports taking her blood pressure medications today and has been on the same doses for the past 10 years.

MappingCandidates.CandidatePreferred: Life Expectancy Less than Ten Years

Utterances.UttText: PMH: HTN, denies hypercholesterolemia Meds: chlorothiozone (?)
25mg tab PO daily, lisinopril 10 mg PO daily VS: 150/92 today in clinic, afebrile PE: S1,S2, regular rate and rhythm. no JVD, no carotid bruits.
Lungs clear to posterior auscultation bilaterally A/P : rule out myocardial infarction in setting of angina.

Phrases.PhraseText: out myocardial infarction in setting of angina.

Utterances.UttText: - ECG today in clinic to identify ST-segment changes - BP cuff for home, instructions for how to properly measure blood pressures at home, return with log - cardiology

Phrases.PhraseText: ST-segment changes - BP cuff for home,
blood pressures at home, return with log - cardiology
